column4: hello, i am using jaunty and i am having trouble getting a port to "open" when i run a game server...the port is forwarded correctly through my router and the port is visible as "closed" from the internet, i need it open so ppl can connect...can someone help?
how are you opening the port?
which port?
just by running the server..? 27960 is port
You need to go into your router, and forward the port.
i have already forwarded the port, the port would be stealthed otherwise...the traffic is reaching the OS...i think it is a problem with security in the OS, not letting the server "listen"
how do you know it's reaching the OS?
i have a port forwarded in the same way for my torrent client and that works fine
okay...
because the port shows as "closed" when the OS is running, and "stealth" when the PC is off
robin87:try out http://www.canyouseeme.org/
robin87:what does it say?
Error: I could not see your service on 78.32.193.174 on port (27960) Reason: Connection refused
it appears the server isnt "listening"
there you go. Has nothing to do woth the OS.
the server doesnt even need to listen. it should at least it the router.
so it is a problem with the server itself?
anyone have XRANDR help?
no, the port forwarding, I believe.
but the port forwarding is fine...my router stealths all ports that aren't forwarded
robin87:Well, all I know is that website can't see it.
Robin87:sorry I cant help more.
ok, thank you
